text: I purchased these glasses in May.  Honestly, I did not wear them but once or twice.  I went to put them on the other day for the 3rd time and the frame is split with the lens falling out.  What a disappointment and it is too late to return them.  I am very frustrated because I could feel my eyes relieved of stress when I put the glasses on, but apparently they are so cheaply made that they break with little effort.  I do not have a home where children or pets are running around.  The frame just plain broke.

text:
Wow. These are my first "blue-blocker, fit-over glasses. I decided to go cheap.

I'm a careful person and I take care of my things. I had read the other 1-star reviews, so I knew I would need to be careful. And I was.

For $17.97 I thought I could get more use out of these than I did. But I didn't make it through even 5 or 6 uses -- over 10 days or so -- before the left-side lens frame broke about 1 inch below the nose-fulcrum.

Wow. Poor engineering, poor quality, poor materials. In my estimation, these glasses would be properly priced at $1.79 not $17.97.
product_title: Sun Shield Fit Over Sunglasses with Blue Blocker HD Driving Lens & Spring Hinges - Fit Over Prescription Glasses

text: These were not shoes, LOL!  (Survey asked me questions about shoes, which I had to answer in order to submit) I was disappointed that these glasses only partially block blue rays. I tested them on a couple of different blue spectrum test sites and they failed the test. On the test image below, both bars should appear identical when wearing the glasses. They do not.
product_title: Sun Shield Fit Over Sunglasses with Blue Blocker HD Driving Lens & Spring Hinges - Fit Over Prescription Glasses
